docs.abstract: After months of stalemate, American negotiators are eager for quick progress on the North American trade deal.
docs.snippet: After months of stalemate, American negotiators are eager for quick progress on the North American trade deal.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After months of fraught negotiations and stalled talks, the Trump administration is aiming to announce a preliminary deal on the North American Free Trade Agreement this month, moving to resolve one trading conflict as a separate clash with China looms.

headline.main: White House Tries to Pull Nafta Back From Brink as Deadlines Loom
headline.print_headline: White House Sees Hope for Agreement on Nafta

docs.abstract: The president said he would sign the measure next week. Stock markets, foreign officials and Republicans were rattled by the news.
docs.snippet: The president said he would sign the measure next week. Stock markets, foreign officials and Republicans were rattled by the news.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Thursday that he would impose stiff tariffs on imports of steel and aluminum, making good on a key campaign promise and rattling stock markets as the prospect of a global trade fight appeared imminent.

headline.main: Trump to Impose Sweeping Steel and Aluminum Tariffs
headline.print_headline: Trump Proclaims Tariffs On Steel and Aluminum, And Stocks Sag in Reply

docs.abstract: President Trump’s proposed tariffs on steel could antagonize South Korea when the United States most needs its ally.
docs.snippet: President Trump’s proposed tariffs on steel could antagonize South Korea when the United States most needs its ally.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s plan to impose stiff steel tariffs would severely punish South Korea, a key diplomatic ally and a major exporter of the metal to the United States, at a moment when America is embarking on a series of high-stakes negotiations to defuse tensions on the Korean Peninsula.

headline.main: Trump’s Trade Plan Threatens to Derail Korean Security Talks
headline.print_headline: Trade Plan Could Derail Korean Security Talks

docs.abstract: President Trump has threatened to blow up global trade rules. Robert Lighthizer is the one who knows where to plant the explosives.
docs.snippet: President Trump has threatened to blow up global trade rules. Robert Lighthizer is the one who knows where to plant the explosives.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Robert Lighthizer just became one of the most powerful people in Washington.

headline.main: The Little-Known Trade Adviser Who Wields Enormous Power in Washington
headline.print_headline: Little-Known Trade Adviser, Now With Enormous Power in Washington

docs.abstract: China has sent a top economic adviser to the United States to restore dialogue and quash a trade war. He faces long odds.
docs.snippet: China has sent a top economic adviser to the United States to restore dialogue and quash a trade war. He faces long odds.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — China’s top economic adviser arrived in Washington this week in an attempt to defuse rapidly escalating tensions with the United States as the prospect of a trade war between the world’s two largest economies looms.

headline.main: China Envoy Seeks to Defuse Tensions With U.S. as a Trade War Brews
headline.print_headline: China Envoy Intends To Ease Trade Tensions

docs.abstract: The Trump administration confronts conflicting desires: to secure a deal in time for approval by the current Congress and to keep contentious proposals on manufacturing.
docs.snippet: The Trump administration confronts conflicting desires: to secure a deal in time for approval by the current Congress and to keep contentious proposals on manufacturing.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration is pushing to reach a deal on the North American Free Trade Agreement by the beginning of May. But the timeline could be complicated by its refusal to budge from contentious proposals aimed at bringing manufacturing back to the United States.

headline.main: U.S. Seeks Quick Nafta Deal, but Allies Balk as It Gives Little Ground
headline.print_headline: U.S. Seeks Quick Nafta Deal But Resists Ceding Ground

docs.abstract: Tariffs on imported steel and aluminum are meant to fulfill President Trump’s vows to protect American industry, but they are drawing a fierce response.
docs.snippet: Tariffs on imported steel and aluminum are meant to fulfill President Trump’s vows to protect American industry, but they are drawing a fierce response.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration said on Thursday that it would impose steep tariffs on metals imported from its closest allies, provoking retaliation against American businesses and consumers and further straining diplomatic ties tested by the president’s combative approach.

headline.main: White House to Impose Metal Tariffs on E.U., Canada and Mexico
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Put Tariffs on Its Key Allies, Risking Reprisal

docs.abstract: The president said that there had been no agreement to provide relief to the Chinese telecom firm in return for trade concessions, though he left the door open to a future pact.
docs.snippet: The president said that there had been no agreement to provide relief to the Chinese telecom firm in return for trade concessions, though he left the door open to a future pact.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump declared on Tuesday that he was not happy with how recent trade talks with China had gone, and said the United States had not reached a deal to suspend penalties on the Chinese telecom firm ZTE, disputing reports that the administration had decided to go easy on the company in return for trade concessions.

headline.main: Trump Denies Reaching Deal With China on ZTE
headline.print_headline: Trump Denies Making Deal to Help Chinese Tech Firm

byline.original: By Ana Swanson and Jim Tankersley

docs.abstract: Fast fashion giants like H&M and Zara are hiring diversity managers and using screening technologies to catch offensive designs before shoppers do.
docs.snippet: Fast fashion giants like H&M and Zara are hiring diversity managers and using screening technologies to catch offensive designs before shoppers do.
docs.lead_paragraph: Every once in a while, tucked into the stream of speedily made garments rushed into stores, designs with shockingly bad taste stand out: a shirt comparing women to dogs at Topman, symbols of the Holocaust on a top at Zara, a slogan that trivializes sexual consent on a piece at Forever 21, or words like “slave” and “slut” used as decorative details on T-shirts at ASOS and Missguided.

headline.main: To Avoid More Racist Hoodies, Retailers Seek Diversity
headline.print_headline: How to Prevent a Racist Hoodie

docs.abstract: Leaders from Oxfam, Microsoft, the Ad Council and more discussed sexual harassment, gender power dynamics and styles of leadership at the World Economic Forum.
docs.snippet: Leaders from Oxfam, Microsoft, the Ad Council and more discussed sexual harassment, gender power dynamics and styles of leadership at the World Economic Forum.
docs.lead_paragraph: Looking back on nearly three decades in the tech sector, Peggy Johnson recalled how she and other women used to steer clear of leering colleagues by taking the long way to their desks, and how they felt pressured to laugh at inappropriate jokes in the office.

headline.main: ‘She’s Not Laughing’: In Davos, Taking on Sexual Harassment
